alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 9:36PM AKDT until April 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and drifting snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. * WHERE...North of Fox. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers will be heavy at times. Southwest winds gusting to 30 mph over summits will cause blowing and drifting snow. The strongest winds and lowest visibility will be now through midnight tonight. Winds will decrease Wednesday morning, and snow will taper off by noon Wednesday. The area south of Fox, including Fairbanks, can expect 1 to 2 inches of snow through Wednesday morning. There is a chance for another significant snow the over Steese Highway east of Chatanika on Wednesday night and Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
